body_html:
Looks like a serious issue; @zheng-xq @zhangyaobit - can we add static shape info to the parameters created by cudnn-rnn? Perhaps by exposing the cudnn library helper functions via swig? Is there a document describing how the shape varies as a fn of hardware and version?

Alternatively can we modify the Adam optimizer to not require static shapes?
body_text:
Looks like a serious issue; @zheng-xq @zhangyaobit - can we add static shape info to the parameters created by cudnn-rnn?  Perhaps by exposing the cudnn library helper functions via swig?  Is there a document describing how the shape varies as a fn of hardware and version?
Alternatively can we modify the Adam optimizer to not require static shapes?
body:
Looks like a serious issue; @zheng-xq @zhangyaobit - can we add static shape info to the parameters created by cudnn-rnn?  Perhaps by exposing the cudnn library helper functions via swig?  Is there a document describing how the shape varies as a fn of hardware and version?

Alternatively can we modify the Adam optimizer to not require static shapes?
